# MTLBlitPassDescriptor

**Class**

A configuration you create to customize a blit command encoder, which affects the runtime behavior of the blit pass you encode with it.

## Declaration

```swift
class MTLBlitPassDescriptor
```

## Overview

You can customize an encoder for a blit pass by creating and configuring an [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLBlitPassDescriptor] instance and passing it to [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBuffer/makeBlitCommandEncoder(descriptor:)].

## Configuring sample buffer attachment descriptors for a blit pass

- **sampleBufferAttachments**: An array of counter sample buffer attachments that you configure for a blit pass.

## Configuring a blit command encoder

- **MTLBlitPassSampleBufferAttachmentDescriptor**: A configuration that instructs the GPU where to store counter data from the beginning and end of a blit pass.
- **MTLBlitPassSampleBufferAttachmentDescriptorArray**: A container that stores an array of sample buffer attachments for a blit pass.

- NSObject
